question_text: A 70-year-old man is evaluated for severe pain on the right side of the back of 1 week's duration and was followed by the appearance of the rash shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: The most likely diagnosis is herpes zoster (Option D). Reactivation of the varicella-zoster virus causes herpes zoster, or shingles. Prodromal symptoms, such as burning, stinging, or tingling, often occur in a localized region, followed by a dermatomal eruption of grouped vesicles or pustules on an erythematous base. The dermatomes most commonly affected are in the thoracic region.
